ReplicaSets use label queries to identify the set of Pods they should be managing.  They then use the exact same Pod API that you used directly in Chapter??5 to create the Pods that they are managing. This notion of ?€?coming in the front door?€? is another central design concept in Kubernetes.
The actual act of managing the replicated Pods is an example of a reconciliation loop. Such loops are fundamental to most of the design and implementation of Kubernetes.
A ReplicaSet acts as a cluster-wide Pod manager, ensuring that the right types and number of Pods are running at all times.
